page.title: 01SEDBERGH GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: The market town of Sedbergh lies just inside the Yorkshire Dales National Park in the county of Cumbria. To the north are the Howgill Fells with Winder Fell dominating the town. Sedbergh is at the meeting point of the A684 (Kendal/Hawes) and the A683 (Kirkby Lonsdale/Kirkby Stephen) roads with the C5101 to Dent to the south-east. Sedbergh is known to many for its boys' public school. Sedbergh is a very important centre, providing all the main services for the surrounding rural area which consists of the village of Dent, several hamlets and many outlying hill-farms. The town is becoming of increasing interest to the tourist and holiday-home owner because of its proximity to the Dales and the Lake District, the M6 motorway being only five miles away.
